Title:
Update of the genus Dictyosphaerium and description of
Mucidosphaerium gen. nov. (Trebouxiophyceae) based on morphological and
molecular data
Abstract:
Recent molecular analyses of Dictyosphaerium strains
revealed a polyphyletic origin of this morphotype within the
Chlorellaceae. The type species D. ehrenbergianum formed an independent
lineage within the Parachlorella clade, assigning the genus to this
clade. Our study focused on three different Dictyosphaerium species to
resolve the phylogenetic position of remaining species. We used combined
analyses of morphology, molecular data based on SSU and ITS rRNA gene
sequences and the comparison of the secondary structure of the SSU,
ITS-1 and ITS-2 for species and genera delineation. The phylogenetic
tree revealed two separate clades of Dictyosphaerium-like strains within
the Parachlorella clade. One clade comprises of the lineages with the
epitype strain of D. ehrenbergianum and two additional lineages which
are here described as D. libertatis sp. nov. and D. lacustris sp. nov.
The second clade comprises of strains with the D. sphagnale and D.
pulchellum morphotypes. On the basis of phylogenetic analyses,
complementary base changes and morphological characters, we describe
Mucidosphaerium gen. nov with the four species M. sphagnale comb. nov.,
M. pulchellum comb. nov., M. palustris sp. nov. and M. planctonica sp.
nov. Based on molecular data, the spherical morphotype cluster in
different lineages of the Parachlorella clade and reveal new species. An
emendation of the genus Dictyosphaerium is included.
